Meter software and Windows 7

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend
  • Report Inappropriate Content

‎12-02-2009 07:14 AM

Looking for a new meter that has software compatible with Windows 7. For 10 years I have been using LifeScan One Touch Ultra II (or earlier models) and now that I loaded Win 7 on two different PCs the software no longer sees the meter. (with both the 9-pin serial cable and USB cables). After several emails to Lifescan I was finally advised to "keep checking back - no fix is in sight, and we realize you will need to change to a different providor. We hope you give us another chance in the future" Very strange reply from a company that large - they are ignoring thousands of windows users with this stance. Anyway, now I need a replacement. Does anyone have any suggestions? (I mean besides dumping Windows and going to Mac - that's a different forum)
Report Inappropriate Content

Ken,

I have no earthy idea about Windows 7 and lifescan, but I have another question for you.

I have a lifescan mini, and I was unaware that you could use it with a Mac. Is this possible?

Helen

The people at LifeScan told me that it is a s/w issue & their software does not yet work w/Windows7. I have always been wary about the " x.0 " releases of anyting from Microsoft...

‎01-09-2010 02:26 AM

I have Freestyle Flash and also the Navagator. Both programs work on the new Windows 7. Call abbott, and have them send you the co-pilot software. Then minipharmacy had the cheapest cable $33 vs $55 at edge park. install the software, plug in the unit, and set up your profile then GO!!!

‎03-08-2010 05:25 AM

Ken Godachy (12/2/2009)
Looking for a new meter that has software compatible with Windows 7. For 10 years I have been using LifeScan One Touch Ultra II (or earlier models) and now that I loaded Win 7 on two different PCs the software no longer sees the meter. (with both the 9-pin serial cable and USB cables). After several emails to Lifescan I was finally advised to "keep checking back - no fix is in sight, and we realize you will need to change to a different providor. We hope you give us another chance in the future" Very strange reply from a company that large - they are ignoring thousands of windows users with this stance. Anyway, now I need a replacement. Does anyone have any suggestions? (I mean besides dumping Windows and going to Mac - that's a different forum)


I use the LifeScan One Touch software on my netbook that has Windows 7 32bit installed on it. I also installed it on my main PC that has Windows 7 64bit. They both run flawlessly and I get readings from my UltraSmart via the USB cable without problems. Make sure you are using the latest version of the software, I had issues with the older versions trying to install.
~MadMikeSS~
Type 1 since about 1997
Pump user since 10/31/2012 - Animas OneTouch Ping
Dexcom 7+ CGM user
